thmuggleton.controller

Class MatchControllerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • thmuggleton.controller.MatchControllerTest

  • public class MatchControllerTest
extends Object
    Tests for the MatchController controller class.

    Adopts BDD naming conventions suggested by Dan North.

    Takes a 'mockist' TDD approach to focus on behavioural expectations since this is well-suited to testing a controller. (See Mocks Aren't Stubs).

    However, to avoid coupling the test too closely to the implementation, looser expectations have been set where these do not affect the central purpose of the test.

    Author:
    Thomas Muggleton

      MatchControllerTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void shouldClearModelAndViewForNewMatch(ActionEvent mockEvent)
      Tests that the controller clears the model and view if no match is in progress and the user tries to create a new match.
      void shouldCorrectlyAddScoreForValidScoreAndValidPlayer(ActionEvent mockEvent)
      Tests that the controller correctly adds a valid score.
      void shouldCorrectlyAddValidPlayer(ActionEvent mockEvent)
      Tests that the match controller correctly adds a valid new player.
      void shouldDisplayErrorDialogForInvalidAddPlayer(ActionEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane optionPane)
      Tests that the controller displays an error dialog if model throws an exception when adding a new player.
      void shouldDisplayErrorDialogForInvalidScore(ActionEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane optionPane)
      Tests that the controller displays an error dialog if an invalid score is entered.
      void shouldDisplayErrorDialogWhenScoreIsAddedToCompletedGame(ActionEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane optionPane)
      Tests that the controller displays an error dialog if a score is added which violates the rules of a bowling match.
      void shouldDisplayWinnerDialogWhenModelStateChangesAndMatchIsOver(ChangeEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane mockedOptionPane)
      Tests that the main controller displays a dialog to the user indicating the match winners when it receives a state change event from the model and the match is finished.
      void shouldNotClearMatchInProgressIfUserChoosesNoOption(ActionEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane mockedOptionPane)
      Tests that the controller does not clear the model and view if a match is in progress and the user selects not to create a new match when prompted.
      void shouldPromptUserBeforeClearingMatchInProgress(ActionEvent mockEvent, JOptionPane mockedOptionPane)
      Tests that the controller prompts the user before clearing the model and view if a match is in progress and the user tries to create a new match.
      void shouldRetrieveAndHighlightWinnersWhenModelStateChanges(ChangeEvent mockEvent)
      Tests that the main controller retrieves the current leaders from the model and highlights these in the view when it receives a state change event from the model.
